rComments: I took her for ECON10A last quarter. As long as you do the homework and ask questions whenever they arise, it isn't that hard to obtain an A. She got me to fall in love with accounting.

Her class is hard due to it most of her lectures being solely based on examples and former quizzes and midterms. Her class is super early, always and office hours are at 7am, and you need to go to pass and get real examples to gain that extra credit. She was flexible in the end so i passed by the skin of my bones... good luck my friend.

Her lectures were useless only showed up for extra credit and her quizzes. Her powerpoints online were essential. Never went to section but went to all the test reviews tell you everything that is on the test pretty clear.

Mallory's class was super easy. I always fell asleep in class or didn't show up, but I went to all my sections. As long as you know what the quiz will be on, and study her previous quizzes, you'll be fine. She normally tells you what's on the quizfinal. I didn't really read the book, I just did practice problems and studied her previous midterms.

The class is easy if you go to her lectures and take note of the things you will need to know. You'll receive many extra credit quizzes opportunities if you attend most lectures. Mallory uses an overhead projector to present notes and goes through them FAST! She is also really generous with grading as she drops the 2 lowest quiz scores out of 5.

Accounting is a pretty easy subject, however the only reason it makes so much sense to me is because I taught myself EVERYTHING. Don't bother going to her office hours because she will just look at you and tell you to read the book. Class is great, especially if you are interested in Business, but she is the absolute worst.

I'm not one of those students who have problems with professors, but Mallory is awful. My theory is that accounting is so easy, she needs to drag it out to make class last a full lecture. Go to your TA sections, they will explain things to you much clearer. Skip the class (except for quizzes).
Basically the same material as in 10B with some new concepts. Grading is the same and there are less opportunities for extra credit. Easy upper division class to take.

Took Mallory for both 10b and 110. In 110 she gives less extra credit and her lectures are less organized. She gave us around 30-35 points extra credit in all. That's still generous since the class was out of 200 points. She also prepares you well for her tests. And if you talk to her after class she's personable and helpful.
Nice lady. Bad teacher.

Mallory's tests are fairly easy once you get past her vague wording of the questions (I suspect that is the reason she has a good rating). However, she is a horrible lecturer. Do not expect to learn much from here. Most people i know had to rely on the book.

Class isn't mandatory, but there were plenty of extra credit opportunities. Sections were very helpful to me. There are 5 quizzes, she drops the 2 lowest grades. Straight-forward class, no tricks. Great professor.

Pretty straightforward class. Lectures aren't mandatory, but there are extra credit opportunities from time to time. Does not curve, but extra credit and other grading policies give a very reasonable buffer.

I learned everything in section or on my own. Lectures were not  helpful at all, but you still need to go due to pop quizzes. Goes kinda fast and is a bit disorganized, but she does give a decent amount of extra credit opportunities. Also, she does nor curve. In the end the class is not that hard.
Mallory is a decent, but don't rely on her to teach you very much. Most of accounting is self taught in her class. She is unorganized in her lecture slides and goes very fast. Be Warned.

I love Mallory! Anyone who has something negative to say about her probably didn't do very well in her class. Exams are straightforward, the only tricky thing is that she loves working problems backwards. She likes to joke and incorporates stories into lecture that I found pretty amusing.

Sweetest lady on the planet. She gives tons of extra credit (which is generally easy to get, provided you actually attend class, because she generally offers it on days when no one shows up)and always does your homework for you in class. Very clear in her examples, and if for some reason you come away confused from a lecture, you have a TA.

The way she words things and sets up problems on tests can be really confusing and way different than the book. The book definitely helps but understanding her writing style is a big part of getting an A.

I took her 10A and 10B class. Got full score out off all the midterms. She told you exactly what is going to be on the exam. If you still get a bad grade on the exam, that is your problem. She care about her students and one of the best professor i ever had. She also gave a lot of extra credit to help the studnets who did poorly.

Mallory is condescending and rude. I would never suggest her to anyone. Lectures are poorly organized, and class is a waste of time. Unfortunately, quizzes are sporadic throughout the quarter so going to class is a good idea. Tests are easy, just use the textbook, do the homework, review with the online lecture slides and the class is an easy A.

Mallory is a great professor. She explains material in depth and her tests are always straightforward- she doesn't try to trick you. Just do the assigned reading and homework, study for the quizzes/tests, and you'll be fine in the class. Sometimes she gives extra credit pop quizzes too, so make sure to show up to class often!

Mallory is an incredibly helpful professor with clear and concise lectures. Her exams are easy if you do the review and all the homework assignments. Mallory actually wants you to pass her class. ALWAYS attend class when you think nobody else will(Day after final or before break). She will likely reward you (extra credit opportunity).

Msllory is a wonderful and caring professor. She genuinely wants the class to do well and offers a tremendous amount of help. Please ask her for help if you need it. I've never seen a college professor that cared so much about her students like her before. I'm definitely glad she was my Econ 10A professor and can't wait to have her again in 10B.

mallory is a great teacher. read the assigned readings before lectures and you'll be able to understand everything because she lectures at a fast pace. practice some hw problems and the sample tests she gives you. doing so will help TREMENDOUSLY. she really cares and really wants you to do well. a teacher i highly recommend
Mallory is the best accounting teacher! Really enjoyed this class, definitely recommend this class. So helpful and concerned for our success. Almost offers TOO much help!

Tests are simple and straight forward if you go to lecture and read the book. The multiple choice on her tests takes some thought, but it should be no problem if you have a firm grip of the material. Mallory knows what she is talking about and has a lot of interesting stories to share as well. She is  competent with the material and very friendly.
I hated this class. Classes are somewhat helpful but she's annoying and mean. She has very hard tests and quizzes that she doesn't curve. Not recommended.

Clear, straight forward, and very helpful. Lectures enhance the material and are very interesting, but the book is very useful as well. Mallory is extremely knowledgeable with the material, and you know she has had her fair experience with the subject. She is a very patient, intelligent, and caring professor. Great professor. Highly recommended!

She is the BEST !!!! very helpful, I had it at 8 AM which sucked but i went to pretty much all the classes and she makes it really easy to understand and tells you exactly what you need to know before the exams.  I like her more than Bob.
